fullText: Janet McTeer and Liev Schreiber bring star power and sexual heat to Christopher Hampton's adaptation of Choderlos de Laclos' epistolary novel about aristocratic libertines.
dtliExcerpt: Janet McTeer and Liev Schreiber bring star power and sexual heat to Christopher Hampton's adaptation of Choderlos de Laclos' epistolary novel about aristocratic libertines.
bwwExcerpt: Schreiber gives it his best shot, but the sensitive feelings of a charming libertine don't register in the same way that his more animal appetites do. Not that animal appetites are quite the thing for this play. Schreiber is a strong actor and a studly kind of male, and despite a constricting costume and skull-pinching wig, he exudes a modern manliness that hardly suits the effete Valmont.
showScoreExcerpt: Janet McTeer and Liev Schreiber bring star power and sexual heat to Christopher Hampton's adaptation of Choderlos de Laclos' epistolary novel about aristocratic libertines.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This appears to be a brief promotional description or headline rather than an actual review with critical evaluation; openai: The text is a brief mention of the actors and the source material, lacking evaluative content or a verdict about the production.
